title: Nico van der Meel
text: Nico van der Meel is a Dutch tenor. He made his debut with the <a href="Concertgebouw%20Orchestra">Concertgebouw Orchestra</a> during the 1987/1988 season and made a recording of Bach's "<a href="St%20John%20Passion">St John Passion</a>", conducted by <a href="Sigiswald%20Kuijken">Sigiswald Kuijken</a>. Between 1989 and 1996, he made several tours and recordings of Bach's "<a href="Mass%20in%20B%20minor">Mass in B minor</a>" and "<a href="St%20Matthew%20Passion">St Matthew Passion</a>". He has since performed with conductors such as <a href="Nikolaus%20Harnoncourt">Nikolaus Harnoncourt</a>, <a href="John%20Eliot%20Gardiner">John Eliot Gardiner</a>, <a href="Gustav%20Leonhardt">Gustav Leonhardt</a>, <a href="Peter%20Schreier">Peter Schreier</a>, <a href="Jan%20Willem%20de%20Vriend">Jan Willem de Vriend</a>, <a href="Helmuth%20Rilling">Helmuth Rilling</a>, <a href="Michel%20Corboz">Michel Corboz</a> and Sir <a href="Colin%20Davis">Colin Davis</a>. He has also performed in a number of <a href="opera">opera</a>tic roles, including Alfred in "<a href="Die%20Fledermaus">Die Fledermaus</a>" by <a href="Johann%20Strauss%20II">Johann Strauss</a>, Sellem in <a href="Igor%20Stravinsky">Igor Stravinsky</a>'s "<a href="The%20Rake%27s%20Progress">The Rake's Progress</a>", Pedrillo in <a href="Wolfgang%20Amadeus%20Mozart">Mozart</a>'s "<a href="Die%20Entf%C3%BChrung%20aus%20dem%20Serail">Die Entführung aus dem Serail</a>" under <a href="Christopher%20Hogwood">Christopher Hogwood</a>, among others. He is a member of the group <a href="Camerata%20Trajectina">Camerata Trajectina</a> and conducts the <a href="William%20Byrd%20Vocal%20Ensemble">William Byrd Vocal Ensemble</a>, which specializes in <a href="a%20cappella">a cappella</a> music from the 16th to the 20th century.
